a:s.a:s: /* * Library: IMMZD18SCholeraWCRBSVaccine3DosesLogic (IMMZ.D18.S.Cholera.WC-rBS vaccine 3-dose schedule) * Schedule Table: Whole cell-recombinant B subunit (WC-rBS) vaccine (Dukoral), 3-dose schedule for clients aged 2–5 years */ library IMMZD18SCholeraWCRBSVaccine3DosesLogic

a:t.name: pseudo
a:t.value: "Vaccine type" = "Cholera vaccines") = 0 AND (2 years ≤ Today's date − "Date of birth" ≤ 5 years)

a:s.a:s: "No cholera primary series dose was administered"
"Dose number of the latest primary series dose is less than three"
"The latest cholera dose was administered more than 6 weeks ago"
"The latest cholera dose was administered approximately more than 6 months ago {Member States defined exact interval}"

operand.name: Client's age is less than 2 years
No cholera primary series dose was administered
Dose number of the latest primary series dose is less than three
The latest cholera dose was administered more than 6 weeks ago
The latest cholera dose was administered approximately more than 6 months ago {Member States defined exact interval}

a:t.name: create
a:t.value:
For WC-rBS vaccine (Dukoral), 3 doses should be given to children 2–5 years of age, with an interval of 1-6 weeks between doses. If the interval since the last dose ≥ 6 weeks, restart the primary series.
Revaccination for children aged 2–5 years: If more than 6 months have passed since completion of primary vaccination series, the primary series of 3 doses should be repeated.

a:s.a:s: 'For WC-rBS vaccine (Dukoral), 3 doses should be given to children 2–5 years of age, with an interval of 1-6 weeks between doses. If the interval since the last dose ≥ 6 weeks, restart the primary series. Revaccination for children aged 2–5 years: If more than 6 months have passed since completion of primary vaccination series, the primary series of 3 doses should be repeated.'

operand.value: For WC-rBS vaccine (Dukoral), 3 doses should be given to children 2–5 years of age, with an interval of 1-6 weeks between doses. If the interval since the last dose ≥ 6 weeks, restart the primary series. Revaccination for children aged 2–5 years: If more than 6 months have passed since completion of primary vaccination series, the primary series of 3 doses should be repeated.

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: To be determined by Member States; however, there is no recommended overdue date.

a:t.name: pseudocode
a:t.value: To be determined by Member States; however, there is no recommended expiration date and individuals are always eligible to be vaccinated.
